passage: While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes: • The unemployment rate measures the percentage of people in the labor force who are without jobs. • An increase in the unemployment rate can be an indicator of a weakening economy. • Some argue that the unemployment rate doesn't fully capture the extent of joblessness, as it doesn't account for underemployment or discouraged workers. • The U-6 rate is an alternative measure that includes part-time workers who want full-time jobs and discouraged workers who have stopped looking for work.
question: Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to explain the limitation of the standard unemployment rate?

choices.A: The unemployment rate is an important economic indicator that measures the percentage of jobless people in the labor force.
choices.B: A rising unemployment rate can signal a weakening economy, which is a cause for concern among policymakers.
choices.C: The standard unemployment rate may not fully capture the extent of joblessness, as it doesn't account for underemployment or discouraged workers.
choices.D: The U-6 rate is an alternative measure of unemployment that includes part-time workers and discouraged workers, providing a more comprehensive view of the labor market.

explanation: C: 'The standard unemployment rate may not fully capture the extent of joblessness, as it doesn't account for underemployment or discouraged workers.' is the correct answer because it effectively explains the limitation of the standard unemployment rate using the relevant information from the notes.
distractor_explanation: 'The unemployment rate is an important economic indicator that measures the percentage of jobless people in the labor force.' is incorrect because it does not address the limitation of the standard unemployment rate.

'A rising unemployment rate can signal a weakening economy, which is a cause for concern among policymakers.' is incorrect because it focuses on the implications of the unemployment rate rather than its limitations.

'The U-6 rate is an alternative measure of unemployment that includes part-time workers and discouraged workers, providing a more comprehensive view of the labor market.' is incorrect because it primarily focuses on the U-6 rate rather than explaining the limitation of the standard unemployment rate.
